----- Original Message -----
From: Chris Harrington <chris-harrington@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, September 23, 1999 2:10 PM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Wizards Misconceptions


> From: "Chris Harrington" <chris-harrington@...>
>
> Just wanted to clear up a few misconceptions in Aljernon / Alan Charity 's
> post
>
> Tarton's Staff - Once you get to the level that you can actually get
> this item you shouldn't be meleeing anyway. At this point all weapons are
> strictly for stat bonuses. I'm thinking to myself that Tarton's staff and
> the Glowing stein would make an awesome combo. Plus 20 Int.
>
> Root/Enstill - Out of all the classes that get this spell line, ALL
of
> the classes have the same problems as your version. Snare rules in every
> way over root/enstill. It's one of the best spells in the game for
dungeon
> diving. Try going to Lower Gukk without someone who can snare. I
guarantee
> you won't last long.
>
> Crowd control - Yes, Enchanter's absolutely rule at this. It's what
we
> do. Everything else is just cream. The problem is, this is how we add to
> the group. Yes we can do DD, but it absolutely sucks. Extremely long
cast
> time AND refresh rate. Much better off De-buffing and crowd controling.
> There are long periods of time when I'm with my group that I never do a
> SINGLE point of damage to any MOB's. And that's the way I want it,
because
> I've slowed it, weakened it, sped up my party members, and then cast
clarity
> and other buffs.
>
> And My absolute biggest BEEF with your post - Mez'ing and mem blurring
> not being resistable. Your friend mez'd and blurred a HG at level 20?
> Absolutely utter CRAP. No way. Never happened. The only way I'll ever
> believe that is if I see him do it. Mez and mem blur IS resistable. I
get
> resisted ALL of the time, especially if I don't Tashani first. Pure
> misinformation of your "friends" part
>
> And how do I know all of this you ask?
>
>
> Laszarus - Level 44 Enchanter - Povar
>
> Maureen - Level 31 Wizard - Povar
>
>
>
